doc.title: Leave It to Beaver

credit.role: Lady in Train Station Waiting Room
Classified ad lady at Courier Sun
Gus, the young man in bar
Man who got his lawn mowed

doc.plot: The Cleavers are the 1950's 'All-American Family' in this 'feel-good' family sitcom. Parents Ward and June, and older brother Wally, try to keep Theodore ('the Beaver') out of trouble. However, Beaver continues to end up in one kind of jam or another. Unlike real life, these situations are always easily resolved to the satisfaction of all involved and the Beaver gets off with a few stern moralistic words of parental advice. Instigator and troublemaker Eddie Haskell is an older kid who always manages to avoid being caught.
